## Public Member Functions

### findSymbol() {#a3acbc4aeeddc8e52c6b69854432f211c}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>JITSymbol LinkingSymbolResolver::findSymbol (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> std::string &amp; Name)</>}
  labels = {["virtual"]}>
This method returns the address of the specified function or variable.

It is used to resolve symbols during module linking.

If the returned symbol&#39;s address is equal to ~0ULL then <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/runtimedyld">RuntimeDyld</a> will skip all relocations for that symbol, and the client will be responsible for handling them manually.

Declaration at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/mcjit/mcjit-h/#l00033">33</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/mcjit/mcjit-h">MCJIT.h</a>, definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/mcjit/mcjit-cpp/#l00672">672</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/mcjit/mcjit-cpp">MCJIT.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### findSymbolInLogicalDylib() {#a6902252429e09a9d391dd020f8d91e96}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>JITSymbol llvm::LinkingSymbolResolver::findSymbolInLogicalDylib (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> std::string &amp; Name)</>}
  labels = {["inline", "virtual"]}>
This method returns the address of the specified symbol if it exists within the logical dynamic library represented by this <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/jitsymbolresolver">JITSymbolResolver</a>.

Unlike findSymbol, queries through this interface should return addresses for hidden symbols.

This is of particular importance for the Orc JIT APIs, which support lazy compilation by breaking up modules: Each of those broken out modules must be able to resolve hidden symbols provided by the others. Clients writing memory managers for <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mcjit">MCJIT</a> can usually ignore this method.

This method will be queried by <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/runtimedyld">RuntimeDyld</a> when checking for previous definitions of common symbols.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/mcjit/mcjit-h/#l00036">36</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/executionengine/lib/executionengine/mcjit/mcjit-h">MCJIT.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>
